channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: "You're the you're the kind of customer I'm happy to lose", the Amazon boss told a racist customer threatening to stop shopping at the online giant after it publicly backed the Black Lives Matter movement.
item.title: Amazon's Bezos decries 'sickening' answer to Black Lives Matter post

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The global death toll from coronavirus has passed 403,000 and there are more than 7 million known cases of infection, according to Johns Hopkins University.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: US enters recession as global COVID-19 cases surpass 7 million, Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: The Queensland government is still considering a proposal to allow fans into the state's AFL stadiums as early as this week when the competition resumes.
item.title: Queensland government yet to make AFL crowds decision

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: About 300 people are searching for William Callaghan who spent the night in life-threatening conditions after becoming separated from his family.
item.title: Race to find autistic teen missing in freezing cold on Mount Disappointment

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: The body of a 20-year-old woman was found in a townhouse near Penrith on Monday night after interstate family members called police with concerns for her welfare.
item.title: Body of woman found in Sydney's west after family report concerns

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Luc Longley didn't feature in The Last Dance. But he did make an appearance in a Zoom-style meeting with the Cats.
item.title: How the bullish Cats got Luc Longley's tongue

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: All 298 on board the plane were killed, including 38 people who called Australia home, when it was shot down by Russian-backed rebels.
item.title: Australian police helped prove Russian-made missile downed MH17

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 9, 2020

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The Dragons could have a new coach by the end of the day as club officials call an emergency meeting, with Dean Young in the frame to replace McGregor.
item.title: McGregor's tenure could be over as Dragons call emergency board meeting to discuss coach's future

item.description: Collingwood's American giant Mason Cox will be left out of the Magpies team that takes on Richmond in Thursday night's AFL season restart.
item.title: Mason Cox to miss Magpies' clash with Richmond

item.dc:creator: Daile Cross
item.description: A department spokesman said although the investigation was ongoing, a preliminary assessment found "no evidence of any unreasonable force or an alleged ‘body slam’ incident as reported in the media".
item.title: 'No evidence of body slam' at WA women's prison, authorities say

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The Australia sharemarket has soared by as much as 3.3 per cent to new three-month highs, chasing Wall Street's overnight gains.
item.title: ASX surges 3.3pc at the open, $A above US70c

item.description: The Benambra Buck Runners have been capturing wild brumbies for decades. They are angry about the Victorian government's proposal to cull the high country icon by helicopter shooting and want a chance to work with government to manage the population.
item.title: The Benambra Buck Runners

item.description: The Warriors will pull their team from the NSW Cup and join forces next season with Redcliffe and might play games at Dolphin Stadium.
item.title: Warriors team up with Qld Cup heavyweights Redcliffe

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Australians loading up on computer monitors and power drills during the coronavirus isolation have helped the two Wesfarmers chains post record sales growth.
item.title: Lockdown spending puts a rocket under sales at Bunnings, Officeworks

item.description: For several days, North Korea has lashed out at South Korea, threatening to close an inter-Korean liaison office.
item.title: North Korea says it will sever hotlines with South Korea

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Dozens of SES volunteers had joined police in their search, as overnight temperatures plunged. A separate search for a woman missing at Slacks Creek is ongoing.
item.title: Woman missing for four days near Somerset Dam found

item.description: The 20-year-old has been ruled out of Saturday's round-two clash with West Coast after he tweaked a hamstring at training.
item.title: Suns' prospect Rankine's AFL debut on hold

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: With a decision on the host due in two weeks, Brazil has conceded it cannot run a major tournament following the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Australia-NZ bid for Women's World Cup boosted by Brazil withdrawal

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: The temperature dipped below zero across Melbourne's suburbs and in every region of Victoria.
item.title: Melbourne shivers through coldest June morning in years

item.description: Mining companies effectively buy the sites, and the right to make decisions on the cultural future of the site and the people who value them most.
item.title: Juukan was not alone: The true extent of WA sites sacrificed for the sake of the almighty dollar

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: The application is to destroy more than 70 heritage sites, including dozens of rock shelters, campsites and rock paintings and engravings – the 60,000-year-old rock shelter among them – to expand its Queens mine, part of the Solomon project.
item.title: 'Default setting stuck on destroy': FMG's plan to blast 60,000-year-old site

item.description: Salaries in government-held areas barely stretch to cover the cost of a bowl of fruit.
item.title: Thousands of Syrians take to streets in anti-Assad protests

item.description: The Braunschweig state prosecutor said police needed more information about where Christian Brückner had lived so police can search for Madeleine's body.
item.title: Germans 'have evidence' Madeleine McCann was killed

item.description: More than 7 million people have been reported infected with the coronavirus globally and over 400,000 have died.
item.title: 'Far from over': WHO head urges vigilance as pandemic grows

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for bright start to week, $A rises

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The Wests Tigers playmaker has expressed his disbelief at initially failing a roadside drugs test in the hours following the Tigers' loss to the Titans.
item.title: 'I was in shock': Josh Reynolds fights to clear his name

item.description: The shocking rally in US stocks has claimed another bear: Stan Druckenmiller.
item.title: 'Far too cautious': Legendary investor misses out on Wall Street rally

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Demonstrators' anger over the May 25 death of Floyd, 46, is giving way to a growing determination to make his case a turning point in race relations.
item.title: Mourners pay tribute to George Floyd as pressure mounts for US police reform

item.description: Investors greeted the first recession in 11 years with yet another stock surge that sent the Nasdaq to a new record and saw the S&P 500 wipe out its losses for the year.
item.title: Record day: Wall Street brushes off recession call as stocks surge

item.description: Under the list of recommendations, officers would be required to carry their own professional liability insurance making the worst offenders uninsurable.
item.title: After vote to abolish Minneapolis police, groups offer reform

item.description: The global economy will contract the most since World War II this year due to the COVID-19 pandemic,says the World Bank.
item.title: World Bank forecasts worst global recession in eight decades

item.description: Democrats have proposed a sweeping overhaul of police oversight and procedures, a potentially far-reaching legislative response to mass protests across the country.
item.title: Democrats kneel for 8 minutes before unveiling bill to rein in police misconduct

item.description: The designation was expected, but notable for its speed, a mere four months after the recession began.
item.title: US economy entered recession in February, ending record-long expansion

item.description: Scarred by the deadliest coronavirus outbreak in the US, New York City gradually began reopening on Monday in a turning point in the three-month-long crisis.
item.title: 'All eyes' on New York: Reopening tests city torn by crises

item.description: Lawyers for Britain's Prince Andrew have hit back at claims the royal was not co-operating with US prosecutors investigating the late financier Jeffrey Epstein.
item.title: Prince Andrew's lawyers hit back over US inquiry into Jeffrey Epstein

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: Within two minutes, tears. Within five, anger. On Q+A, politicians were sidelined by heartbroken Indigenous Australians urging change. First: "Do not kill us."
item.title: On Q+A, tears, heartbreak, anger and a request: 'Do not kill us'

item.description: The world's biggest money manager started off 2020 by dropping a big, green bombshell. The world has changed since then.
item.title: BlackRock's green dream got complicated fast

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Councils in NSW have seized on a once-in-a-decade review of Australia's national environment laws to push for better recognition of local government's role in protecting biodiversity and slowing climate change.
item.title: NSW councils urge reforms to 'challenging' national environment laws

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The pandemic has hit the banking world hard, but the country's youngest banks maintain they can use the crisis to their advantage.
item.title: Neobanks look for silver lining in virus shock

item.dc:creator: Brandon Jack
item.description: Urging Australia to move on, as one local government official did recently, is a way of turning your back on unease. It resolves nothing.
item.title: As a white Australian talking about racism you should feel a sense of discomfort

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: In what will be his first game in three months, Nathan Cleary's father and Panthers coach Ivan has backed him to make an immediate impact in the Battle of the West on Friday night.
item.title: 'He's ready': Coach backs Cleary to handle Eels on return

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: A business coalition will chart a path to recovery, with the aim of restarting large, open-air events in spring.
item.title: Rivals unite to revive a live entertainment industry 'on its knees'

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: The chief of ASIO has criticised tech companies for resisting requests by police and security agencies to access information in cyberspace.
item.title: COVID has made Australia 'less safe': ASIO boss

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: Vladimir Lenin once remarked that "there are decades where nothing happens and there are weeks when decades happen". We are living through such weeks now.
item.title: History has stepped on the accelerator and is taking Australia along for the ride
